Posted By: Taudisban (9/17/2013 11:41:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is much better than it seems. It can often produce a **ton** of mana, and it can come out turn 3 with a mana dork such as [Elvish Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Mystic). At 4 toughness, it is out of bolt range, or in standard, [Lighting Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lighting Strike). This is very strong in a mono-green deck with [Polukranos, World Eater](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polukranos, World Eater) and green heavy cards like [Kalonian Tusker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kalonian Tusker).
posts.html:
This is much better than it seems. It can often produce a ton of mana, and it can come out turn 3 with a mana dork such as Elvish Mystic. posts.post_content:
Turn 1, forest, play something like [Experiment One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Experiment One)  
Turn 2, forest or mountain, [Burning Tree-Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Tree-Emissary) into [Zhur-Taa Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zhur-Taa Druid)  
Turn 3, land, [Karametra's Acolyte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karametra's Acolyte) tapping for ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)  
Turn 4 you have 9 mana before even playing a land and at least 3 cards in hand.  
  
Alternatively:  
Turn 1, forest, [Elvish Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Mystic)  
Turn 2, forest or mountain, Burning-Tree Emissary and... [Bow of Nylea](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bow of Nylea), [Domri Rade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Domri Rade), [Witchstalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Witchstalker), [Boon Satyr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boon Satyr)?  
Turn 3, land, Acolyte tapping for ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol).  
So... Y'know, 11 mana if you have another land in hand (10 if you played Domri). 14 if that land is [Nykthos, shrine to Nyx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nykthos, shrine to Nyx), which can also get away with being your third land. On turn 4.  
  
She seems pretty damn impressive considering that's mostly just throwing her in as an extra part to my current standard deck's eng... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Compare to the flavor text of Voyaging Satyr, and look at the pictures. The Satyr druid steals the human druid's fruit. But, then again, she obviously has *plenty* even if she notices in the illustration the conspicuous absence of some of it. Wizards did a nice job on the dialogue between the two cards. I think the buildings in the backgrounds may be the same, too.

Posted By: Kariuko (10/24/2013 8:16:49 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: We all know what you can do with this in standard, but imagine.... this thing is hypothetically playable in modern. Green Demands more hard mana than any other color, and this gives you access to all of it. [Leatherback Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leatherback Baloth). [Primalcrux](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primalcrux). [Khalni Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Khalni Hydra). [Deus of Calamity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deus of Calamity) and any other Shadowmoor Demigod that supports green. You can use these things and other, smaller mana dorks to ramp out all of the above, then drop an Eldrazi Titan like [Emerakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emerakul), a seriously pumped [Primordial Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Hydra), A [Gelatinous Genesis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gelatinous Genesis) unlike anything ever seen by non-infinite decks, and pump an [Omnath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Omnath) to the size of texas. Throw in a few [Asceticism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Asceticism)s to protect your stuff and away you go.
posts.html:
We all know what you can do with this in standard, but imagine.... this thing is hypothetically playable in modern. Green Demands more hard mana than any other color, and this gives you access to all of it. Leatherback Baloth. Primalcrux. Khalni Hydra. Deus of Calamity and any other Shadowmoor Demigod that supports green. You can use these things and other, smaller mana dorks to ramp out all of the above, then drop an Eldrazi Titan like Emerakul, a seriously pumped Primordial Hydra, A Gelatinous Genesis unlike anything ever seen by non-infinite decks, and pump an Omnath to the size of texas. Throw in a few Asceticisms to protect your stuff and away you go.

Posted By: TowerDefender (10/5/2013 7:47:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I decided to build a (Standard) deck around this. The core of the deck is  
4 [Elvish Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Mystic)  
4 [Voyaging Satyr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voyaging Satyr)  
4 [Sylvan Caryatid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Caryatid)  
3 [Verdant Haven](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Haven)  
3 [Karametra's Acolyte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karametra's Acolyte)  
4 [Nylea's Disciple](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nylea's Disciple)  
2 [Polukranos, World Eater](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polukranos, World Eater)  
4 [Garruk, Caller of Beasts](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk, Caller of Beasts)  
  
3 [Nykthos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nykthos) + 19-21 other lands  
  
Now for the remaining 8-10 cards, insert your favorite fatties or giant spells, doesn't even matter which color since this deck has 5-color support (and room for shocklands). If it is too big for this deck, it just can't be played anywhere. Or go even further with [Triton's Tactic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Triton's Tactic) untap shenanigans and try to generate 22 mana for an X = 20 [Clan Defiance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clan Defiance).
posts.html:
I decided to build a (Standard) deck around this. The core of the deck is
4 Elvish Mystic
4 Voyaging Satyr
4 Sylvan Caryatid
3 Verdant Haven
3 Karametra's Acolyte
4 Nylea's Disciple
2 Polukranos, World Eater
4 Garruk, Caller of Beasts

3 Nykthos + 19-21 other lands

Now for the remaining 8-10 cards, insert your favorite fatties or giant spells, doesn't even matter which color since this deck has 5-color support (and room for shocklands). If it is too big for this deck, it just can't be played anywhere. Or go even further with Triton's Tactic untap shenanigans and try to generate 22 mana for an X = 20 Clan Defiance.
